trans-unit.source: General Linux Installation Notes
trans-unit.target: General Linux Installation Notes

trans-unit.source: The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the convert-vhd cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the convert-vhd cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: When installing the Linux system it is recommended that you use standard partitions rather than LVM (often the default for many installations).
trans-unit.target: When installing the Linux system it is recommended that you use standard partitions rather than LVM (often the default for many installations).

trans-unit.source: This will avoid LVM name conflicts with cloned VMs, particularly if an OS disk ever needs to be attached to another VM for troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: This will avoid LVM name conflicts with cloned VMs, particularly if an OS disk ever needs to be attached to another VM for troubleshooting.

trans-unit.source: LVM or [RAID](virtual-machines-linux-configure-raid.md) may be used on data disks if preferred.
trans-unit.target: LVM or [RAID](virtual-machines-linux-configure-raid.md) may be used on data disks if preferred.

trans-unit.source: NUMA is not supported for larger VM sizes due to a bug in Linux kernel versions below 2.6.37.
trans-unit.target: NUMA is not supported for larger VM sizes due to a bug in Linux kernel versions below 2.6.37.

trans-unit.source: This issue primarily impacts distributions using the upstream Red Hat 2.6.32 kernel.
trans-unit.target: This issue primarily impacts distributions using the upstream Red Hat 2.6.32 kernel.

trans-unit.source: Manual installation of the Azure Linux agent (waagent) will automatically disable NUMA in the GRUB configuration for the Linux kernel.
trans-unit.target: Manual installation of the Azure Linux agent (waagent) will automatically disable NUMA in the GRUB configuration for the Linux kernel.

trans-unit.source: Do not configure a swap partition on the OS disk.
trans-unit.target: Do not configure a swap partition on the OS disk.

trans-unit.source: The Linux agent can be configured to create a swap file on the temporary resource disk.
trans-unit.target: The Linux agent can be configured to create a swap file on the temporary resource disk.

trans-unit.source: More information about this can be found in the steps below.
trans-unit.target: More information about this can be found in the steps below.

trans-unit.source: All of the VHDs must have sizes that are multiples of 1 MB.
trans-unit.target: All of the VHDs must have sizes that are multiples of 1 MB.

trans-unit.source: Linux Kernel Requirements
trans-unit.target: Linux Kernel Requirements

trans-unit.source: The Linux Integration Services (LIS) drivers for Hyper-V and Azure are contributed directly to the upstream Linux kernel.
trans-unit.target: The Linux Integration Services (LIS) drivers for Hyper-V and Azure are contributed directly to the upstream Linux kernel.

trans-unit.source: Many distributions that include a recent Linux kernel version (i.e. 3.x) will have these drivers available already, or otherwise provide backported versions of these drivers with their kernels.
trans-unit.target: Many distributions that include a recent Linux kernel version (i.e. 3.x) will have these drivers available already, or otherwise provide backported versions of these drivers with their kernels.

trans-unit.source: These drivers are constantly being updated in the upstream kernel with new fixes and features, so when possible it is recommended to run an [endorsed distribution](../linux-endorsed-distributions.md) that will include these fixes and updates.
trans-unit.target: These drivers are constantly being updated in the upstream kernel with new fixes and features, so when possible it is recommended to run an [endorsed distribution](../linux-endorsed-distributions.md) that will include these fixes and updates.

trans-unit.source: If you are running a variant of Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions **6.0-6.3**, then you will need to install the latest LIS drivers for Hyper-V.
trans-unit.target: If you are running a variant of Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions **6.0-6.3**, then you will need to install the latest LIS drivers for Hyper-V.

trans-unit.source: The drivers can be found [at this location](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=254263&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: The drivers can be found [at this location](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=254263&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: As of RHEL **6.4+** (and derivatives) the LIS drivers are already included with the kernel and so no additional installation packages are needed to run those systems on Azure.
trans-unit.target: As of RHEL **6.4+** (and derivatives) the LIS drivers are already included with the kernel and so no additional installation packages are needed to run those systems on Azure.

trans-unit.target: For those distributions or vendors who maintain their own kernel, some effort will be required to regularly backport the LIS drivers from the upstream kernel to your custom kernel.

trans-unit.source: Even if you are already running a relatively recent kernel version, it is highly recommended to keep track of any upstream fixes in the LIS drivers and backport those as needed.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Linux Agent
trans-unit.target: The Azure Linux Agent

trans-unit.source: The [Azure Linux Agent](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) (waagent) is required to properly provision a Linux virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The [Azure Linux Agent](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) (waagent) is required to properly provision a Linux virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can get the latest version, file issues or submit pull requests at the [Linux Agent GitHub repo](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent).
trans-unit.target: You can get the latest version, file issues or submit pull requests at the [Linux Agent GitHub repo](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent).

trans-unit.source: The Linux agent is released under the Apache 2.0 license.
trans-unit.target: The Linux agent is released under the Apache 2.0 license.

trans-unit.source: Many distributions already provide RPM or deb packages for the agent, and so in some cases this can be installed and updated with little effort.
trans-unit.target: Many distributions already provide RPM or deb packages for the agent, and so in some cases this can be installed and updated with little effort.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Linux Agent requires Python v2.6+.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Linux Agent requires Python v2.6+.

trans-unit.source: The agent also requires the python-pyasn1 module.
trans-unit.target: The agent also requires the python-pyasn1 module.

trans-unit.source: Most distributions provide this as a separate package that can be installed.
trans-unit.target: Most distributions provide this as a separate package that can be installed.

trans-unit.source: In some cases the Azure Linux Agent may not be compatible with NetworkManager.
trans-unit.target: In some cases the Azure Linux Agent may not be compatible with NetworkManager.

trans-unit.source: Many of the RPM/Deb packages provided by distributions configure NetworkManager as a conflict to the waagent package, and thus will uninstall NetworkManager when you install the Linux agent package.
trans-unit.target: Many of the RPM/Deb packages provided by distributions configure NetworkManager as a conflict to the waagent package, and thus will uninstall NetworkManager when you install the Linux agent package.
